body_html: A lot of this information (labels, picking up a ticket) is found in the contribution guide. I'm not 100% sure about this, but I think external collaborators (e.g. people who have not been added to a team on GH) might not be able to set labels to issues themselves. And because of the way GH works, I think they also cannot assign themselves or be assigned to an issue unless they're added to the organisation/repo?
body_text: A lot of this information (labels, picking up a ticket) is found in the contribution guide. I'm not 100% sure about this, but I think external collaborators (e.g. people who have not been added to a team on GH) might not be able to set labels to issues themselves. And because of the way GH works, I think they also cannot assign themselves or be assigned to an issue unless they're added to the organisation/repo?
body: A lot of this information (labels, picking up a ticket) is found in the [contribution guide](https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/rgsoc-teams/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md). I'm not 100% sure about this, but I think external collaborators (e.g. people who have not been added to a team on GH) might not be able to set labels to issues themselves. And because of the way GH works, I think they also cannot assign themselves or be assigned to an issue unless they're added to the organisation/repo?
